SENT.plain: A case of extracranial carotid artery dissection investigated both by conventional brain imaging and by arteriography is presented
The radionuclide angiogram showed a flip-flop phenomenon on the left hemisphere
The implications, including clinical features, pathogenesis, diagnosis, and treatment are discussed
Dissection of extracranial carotid artery is a cause of carotid hypoactivity, and this phenomenon is associated directly with a flip-flop phenomenon on brain imaging
